debugging_scenarios.name: Buffer Overflow Exploit
debugging_scenarios.description: Identify and exploit a buffer overflow vulnerability in a given application to gain unauthorized access or execute arbitrary code.
steps: Analyze the target application's memory management.
Craft malicious input to trigger the buffer overflow.
Test the exploit in a controlled environment.
Refine the exploit based on the results.
debugging_scenarios.expected_outcome: Successful execution of arbitrary code on the target system.

debugging_scenarios.name: SQL Injection Attack
debugging_scenarios.description: Perform an SQL injection to manipulate database queries and retrieve or manipulate data.
steps: Identify input fields vulnerable to SQL injection.
Craft SQL queries to exploit the vulnerability.
Execute the injection and observe the behavior.
Extract or alter data from the database.
debugging_scenarios.expected_outcome: Acquisition of sensitive data or control over the database.

debugging_scenarios.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Attack
debugging_scenarios.description: Execute a cross-site scripting attack to run malicious scripts in the context of a web application.
steps: Identify fields or parameters susceptible to XSS.
Develop a payload to execute on the victim's browser.
Deliver the payload through the web application.
Gain access to user sessions or sensitive information.
debugging_scenarios.expected_outcome: Execution of the payload in the victim's browser context.

debugging_scenarios.name: Remote Code Execution (RCE)
debugging_scenarios.description: Achieve remote code execution on a target system by exploiting a vulnerability.
steps: Identify a remote code execution vulnerability.
Develop an exploit for the identified vulnerability.
Test the exploit against the target system.
Gain control over the target system.
debugging_scenarios.expected_outcome: Remote execution of code leading to system compromise.

debugging_scenarios.name: Reverse Engineering Malware
debugging_scenarios.description: Analyze and understand the behavior of a piece of malware through reverse engineering.
steps: Disassemble or decompile the malware sample.
Analyze the code to understand its functionality.
Identify indicators of compromise (IoCs).
Develop countermeasures to neutralize the threat.
debugging_scenarios.expected_outcome: Detailed understanding of the malware and mitigation strategies.

debugging_scenarios.name: Forensic Analysis of Compromised System
debugging_scenarios.description: Conduct a forensic analysis to understand the scope and impact of a system compromise.
steps: Collect and preserve digital evidence.
Analyze logs and system artifacts.
Determine the method of intrusion.
Assess the extent of the damage.
debugging_scenarios.expected_outcome: Comprehensive report detailing the compromise and recommendations for recovery.
